title: Miner Mike's Discovers Gold
review:
Overview

This is a set that compliments the main 2018 City Mining sets perfectly.  The set comprises of Miner Mike and a substantial brick-built rock element to mine.

Packet

The foil bag contains all the elements nicely and once removed from the comic's front cover is nice and chunky due to the parts contained.  The main image is of Miner Mike himself, waving with a lop-sided grin as he happily mines for his gold.  Interestingly the top-right image is of Miner Mike whereas the rest of the 2018 City Mining sets have a cleaner shaven miner.

Minifigure

Miner Mike is the main character for issue 6 (11th April to 15th May 2018) of the Lego City Comic and is the only Minifgure you get with this packet.  He only appears in one of the four main sets, which is the Mining Power Splitter (60185) priced £12.99 in the UK.  His legs are not printed, but they match the printed braces on his torso, which also sports an orange vest and bare arms with dark gray gloves.  Miner Mike has clearly put in a long shift as he has not had a shave for a while and has a mark on his face indicating the hard work he has completed.  He comes with a pick axe and brick-built detonator too.

Main Build/Parts

Along with the Minifigure you get a 4x5 build to represent a reasonably sized section of rock that when completed is three full bricks high.  A simple but very effective mechanism allows you to pop the two 2x3 sloped bricks from the top to reveal the gold within, sat on a 2x2 jumper plate.  The mechanism can be operated by pushing down, or you could use Miner Mike's pick to lever it open. 

There are no extra special parts in the set in my view, however the gold piece is new for 2018 and if you don't have any of the other sets from this theme (for which there are 23 of these elements) you would be looking at around £70 for the Elves set that contains it (41196) or the £300 Roller Coaster (10261)!

Verdict

This is definitely worth getting if you can.  It's not the best in the line but certainly one of the better ones.  The comic was priced £3.85 so if you only want the Minifigure it would be cheaper than buying 60185 (this review is about six months after the comic was sold!).  I personally think the comic sets are generally quite strong and this one has a Minifigure, a fun explosion mechanism and would give younger children a good introduction into creating their own builds in a simple way using a few bricks.
